content.body: nicolo-ribaudo: Caridy is working on First-class Modules spec text. It might be good for you to connect.

content.body: One thing we can’t do Right Now™ is have `importHook` and `importMeta` fall through to defaults in the realm. I presume this is because we don’t have [[ImportHook]] or [[ImportMeta]] on the realm record Yet™.
content.formatted_body: One thing we can’t do Right Now™ is have importHook and importMeta fall through to defaults in the realm. I presume this is because we don’t have [[ImportHook]] or [[ImportMeta]] on the realm record Yet™.

One thing we can’t do Right Now™ is have importHook and importMeta fall through to defaults in the realm. I presume this is because we don’t have [[ImportHook]] or [[ImportMeta]] on the realm record Yet™.

content.body: And if we had them, they’d have to be host-defined.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: And if we had them, they’d have to be host-defined.

content.body: Maybe we have them but they have other names or forms that obscure them?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Maybe we have them but they have other names or forms that obscure them?

content.body: Kris Kowal: great to hear progress is coming along! Happy to assist where I can as well. I wonder if the `importHook` could be treated as an internal operation to start to avoid the realm issues? As in, a spec function doesn't need to have context? Eg paramaterize `HostResolveImportedModule` by the realm (as it likely should be), and have import hook delegate to that? Then refactor outwards from there? Thinking aloud... not sure if something like that makes sense.

Eg paramaterize HostResolveImportedModule by the realm (as it likely should be), and have import hook delegate to that? Then refactor outwards from there? Thinking aloud... not sure if something like that makes sense.

content.body: Something very much like that in any case.

content.body: Do you plan to put time to these discussions in SES meetings? Or can we resume in our modules meetings?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Do you plan to put time to these discussions in SES meetings? Or can we resume in our modules meetings?

content.body: I can also reach out to caridy as well / or just copy in on anything for feedback too
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I can also reach out to caridy as well / or just copy in on anything for feedback too

content.body: I would like to get crackin’ on nitty gritty as soon as possible and SES meetings will help with that. The contract with Module Harmony calls remains the same, though. When we get together with the stakeholders, have to present from where the group left off.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I would like to get crackin’ on nitty gritty as soon as possible and SES meetings will help with that. The contract with Module Harmony calls remains the same, though. When we get together with the stakeholders, have to present from where the group left off.

content.body: But just putting heads together with Caridy, Nicolo, you, and me to puzzle out what’s possible also makes sense to me.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: But just putting heads together with Caridy, Nicolo, you, and me to puzzle out what’s possible also makes sense to me.

content.body: yeah I'd be happy to put some time into the direct spec questions
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: yeah I'd be happy to put some time into the direct spec questions

content.body: I'm still very hopeful we can improve the modules spec as we do this work
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I'm still very hopeful we can improve the modules spec as we do this work

content.body: and actually make it more capable and more well-defined in the process
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: and actually make it more capable and more well-defined in the process

content.body: Yeah, on the one hand Caridy wants to have the lightest touch possible so the proposal is provably free of surprises.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Yeah, on the one hand Caridy wants to have the lightest touch possible so the proposal is provably free of surprises.

content.body: But I think setting up for a non-normative refactor should be part of the plan.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: But I think setting up for a non-normative refactor should be part of the plan.

content.body: If there's room for some refactoring, like working on any old codebase hopefully we can leave it better than we found it :)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: If there's room for some refactoring, like working on any old codebase hopefully we can leave it better than we found it :)

content.body: Or preceding with a non-normative refactor would work for me too.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Or preceding with a non-normative refactor would work for me too.

content.body: Are you familiar with Chesterton’s Fence?
